summary: REQ-1 and REQ-2 are largely implemented via an icon-only `IntroScreen` and new `App.tsx` logic to show the intro once per app load when an authenticated identity exists. However, the intro screen initially renders fully transparent/hidden for ~1s, which may violate the requirement that the icon be visible while the splash is visible. The diff also includes unrelated changes to actor initialization/admin token URL param utilities, which were not requested and may violate the constraint to confine changes to splash/intro behavior.

missing_requirements.requirement: When the splash screen is visible, the animated gallery icon remains visible and centered on the splash screen (icon-only splash).
missing_requirements.reason: `IntroScreen` initially renders the whole splash container with `opacity-0` and the icon wrapper with `opacity-0`/scaled down until a 1s timer flips `isAnimating` to true, meaning the icon is not visible during the initial portion of the splash render.

hallucinated_features.description: Changes to actor initialization behavior (retry state/backoff, admin token normalization, error classification plumbing) unrelated to splash/intro behavior.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest constrained changes to splash/intro behavior/UI and explicitly disallowed introducing unrelated flows; these actor initialization enhancements are not requested by REQ-1/REQ-2.

hallucinated_features.description: Expanded URL/session parameter utility functions and hash parameter clearing logic unrelated to splash/intro behavior.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-1/REQ-2 and outside the stated scope to keep changes confined to splash/intro behavior/UI.
